page.title: 10Farming, Faceby (page ii)
page.content: {For one farmer's wife day begins 7am, earlier in busy times. Prepare breakfast. Put washing in, 2-3 loads daily. Get girls up for work. Feed horses and poultry, sometimes calves. Breakfast over, household chores - fires in winter (no central heating). May have to help outside: move cattle, sort potatoes, go for tractor spares or livestock feed. Extra baking in busy times to send into fields, or one or more men for lunch 12.30 prompt. Once a week find time for farm accounts and VAT returns. Many phone calls for family as well as farm; interruptions from company reps and deliveries, often involving search for menfolk. Christmas extra is turkey dressing: men pluck, I dress 75-100 birds.{Usually relax 8-8.30.}All in all very busy; sometimes frustrated but love it all, especially my horses.
